title: FAA Establishes Organization Designation Authorization Program, Granting Boeing Self-Certification Powers
description: The FAA formally established the Organization Designation Authorization (ODA) program, allowing aircraft manufacturers like Boeing to delegate certification responsibilities to their own employees. This marked a fundamental shift from direct FAA oversight to industry self-regulation, with Boeing eventually certifying 96% of its own work by 2018.
